oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Heat wave event facilitates defensive responses in invasive C3 plant Ambrosia artemisiifolia L. under elevated CO2 concentration to the detriment of Ophraella communa
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tian, Zhenya
Chao
Zhao, Chenchen
Zhang, Yan
Gao, Xuyuan
Tian, Zhenqi
Chen, Hongsong
Guo, Jianying
Zhou, Zhongshi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ambrosia artemisiifolia
Ophraella communa
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Key messageBeing fed on A. artemisiifolia grown under elevated CO2 and heat wave conditions resulted in the poor performance of O. communa (high mortality, long development period, and low reproduction).Elevated CO2 and heat waves resulted in the accumulation of secondary metabolites in A. artemisiifolia.After feeding on the secondary metabolites accumulated by A. artemisiifolia, the mortality of O. communa increased.
